title: 30 more join Reunion Island’s quality seal program
text:
30 more join Reunion Island’s quality seal program   
Sep 02, 2015 Proudly certified and joining others of Reunion Island’s high quality tourism service providers eTN   
One of Reunion Island’s greatest hallmarks is the quality of its tourism services, in the best of the French tradition but blended with Creole characteristics which make for great holidays. 
At the end of August, 23 new establishments joined the island’s unique Quality Label, while a further 8 saw their companies re-certified after meeting all required criteria during the inspection audit. Since the launch of the program in 2013, a total of now 176 service providers, hotels, resorts, B&Bs, restaurants, and more were certified as meeting a high level of standards, suitable to receive and look after international tourists.

What is the Quality Tourism Reunion Island label all about? It is a regional label in the service of tourism destination development meeting based on a stringent set of measures and criteria, and those certified will have to sign a charter to commit their lasting compliance with the set-out quality standards. 
Through the QTIR label, Reunion Island Tourism (IRT) intends to deal with the increased international competition. Registered in the heart of the strategic areas for tourism development introduced by the IRT, quality approach aims to strengthen the image of its tourism offerings and thus increase traffic to the destination through the promotion of institutions in different sectors activities. 
This quality approach is based on several objectives: 
• improve the quality of tourist services; 
• ensure a quality service to the consumer; 
• distinguish Reunion Island among competing destinations; and 
• strengthen the quality image of Reunion Island in terms of reception, service, and professionalism. Source: Reunion Island Tourism
